about-modal.name: about-modal
about-modal.title: About modal
about-modal.summary: An about modal displays information about an application like product version number(s), as well as any appropriate legal text.

accordion.name: accordion
accordion.title: Accordion
accordion.summary: An accordion is a vertically stacked list that can be expanded and collapsed to reveal and hide nested content.

action-list.name: action-list
action-list.title: Action list
action-list.summary: An action list is a group of actions, controls, or buttons with set spacing.

alert.name: alert
alert.title: Alert
alert.summary: An alert is a non-intrusive notification that shares brief, important messages with users.

application-launcher.name: application-launcher
application-launcher.title: Application launcher
application-launcher.summary: An application launcher is a menu that allows users to launch a separate web application in a new browser window.

avatar.name: avatar
avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.summary: An avatar is a visual representation of a user, which can contain an image or placeholder graphic.

back-to-top.name: back-to-top
back-to-top.title: Back to top
back-to-top.summary: The back to top component is a shortcut that allows users to quickly navigate to the top of a page via a button.

backdrop.name: backdrop
backdrop.title: Backdrop
backdrop.summary: A backdrop is a screen that covers the main content of a page when a modal is opened, to prevent page interaction until the modal is dismissed.

background-image.name: background-image
background-image.title: Background image
background-image.summary: A background image is an image that fills the background of a page.

badge.name: badge
badge.title: Badge
badge.summary: A badge is an annotation that displays a numeric value.

banner.name: banner
banner.title: Banner
banner.summary: A banner is a short message that is shared with users in an unobtrusive, full-width container that cannot be dismissed.

brand.name: brand
brand.title: Brand
brand.summary: A brand is a visual representation of a product—typically its logo.

breadcrumb.name: breadcrumb
breadcrumb.title: Breadcrumb
breadcrumb.summary: A breadcrumb is a secondary navigation method that shows where users are in an application, to help them navigate more efficiently.

button.name: button
button.title: Button
button.summary: A button is an object that communicates and triggers an action when it is clicked or selected.

calendar-month.name: calendar-month
calendar-month.title: Calendar month
calendar-month.summary: A calendar month component allows users to select and navigate between days, months, and years.

card.name: card
card.title: Card
card.summary: A card is a content container that displays entry-level information—typically within dashboards, galleries, and catalogs.

checkbox.name: checkbox
checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.summary: A checkbox is an input control that allows users to select a single item or multiple items from a list.

clipboard-copy.name: clipboard-copy
clipboard-copy.title: Clipboard copy
clipboard-copy.summary: The clipboard copy component allows users to quickly and easily copy content to their clipboard.

code-block.name: code-block
code-block.title: Code block
code-block.summary: A code block contains 2 or more lines of read-only code, which can be copied to a user's clipboard.

code-editor.name: code-editor
code-editor.title: Code editor
code-editor.summary: A code editor is a versatile Monaco-based text editor that supports various programming languages.

content.name: content
content.title: Content
content.summary: A content component contains a block of styled HTML content.

data-list.name: data-list
data-list.title: Data list
data-list.summary: A data list displays large data sets and interactive content in a flexible layout.

date-picker.name: date-picker
date-picker.title: Date picker
date-picker.summary: A date picker allows users to either manually enter a date or select a date from a calendar.

date-and-time-picker.name: date-and-time-picker
date-and-time-picker.title: Date and time picker
date-and-time-picker.summary: A date and time picker allows users to select both a specific date and a time, by combining date picker and time picker components.

description-list.name: description-list
description-list.title: Description list
description-list.summary: A description list displays terms and their corresponding descriptions.

divider.name: divider
divider.title: Divider
divider.summary: A divider is a horizontal or vertical line that is placed between screen elements to create visual divisions and content groupings.

drag-and-drop.name: drag-and-drop
drag-and-drop.title: Drag and drop
drag-and-drop.summary: The drag and drop component allows users to reposition, rearrange, and group items into more relevant and appropriate layouts.

drawer.name: drawer
drawer.title: Drawer
drawer.summary: A drawer is a sliding panel that enters from outside of the viewport, which can be configured to either overlay content or create a sidebar by pushing content.

dropdown.name: dropdown
dropdown.title: Dropdown
dropdown.summary: A dropdown displays a menu of actions that trigger a process and links that navigate to a new location.

dual-list-selector.name: dual-list-selector
dual-list-selector.title: Dual list selector
dual-list-selector.summary: A dual list selector displays 2 interactive lists: a list of selected items and a list of available, selectable items. Users can move items between the lists.

empty-state.name: empty-state
empty-state.title: Empty state
empty-state.summary: An empty state is a screen that is not yet populated with data or information—typically containing a short message and next steps for users.

expandable-section.name: expandable-section
expandable-section.title: Expandable section
expandable-section.summary: An expandable section is a content section with a text toggle that reveals content that is hidden by default.

multiple-file-upload.name: multiple-file-upload
multiple-file-upload.title: Multiple file upload
multiple-file-upload.summary: A multiple file upload component allows users to select and upload multiple files to a specific location.

simple-file-upload.name: simple-file-upload
simple-file-upload.title: Simple file upload
simple-file-upload.summary: A simple file upload component allows users to select and upload a single file to a specific location.

form-control.name: form-control
form-control.title: Form control
form-control.summary: A form control is a form element that guides users and accepts user input, such as text areas and selection menus.

form.name: form
form.title: Form
form.summary: A form is a group of related elements that allow users to provide data and configure options in a variety of contexts, such as within modals, wizards, and pages.

form-select.name: form-select
form-select.title: Form select
form-select.summary: A form select is a form element that embeds browser-native menus.

helper-text.name: helper-text
helper-text.title: Helper text
helper-text.summary: Helper text is a text-based support method that adds additional context to field inputs.

hint.name: hint
hint.title: Hint
hint.summary: A hint is an in-app message that shares reminders, explanations, or calls to action within a page or modal.

icon.name: icon
icon.title: Icon
icon.summary: An icon component is a container that supports icons of varying dimensions and styles, as well as spinners.

inline-edit.name: inline-edit
inline-edit.title: Inline edit
inline-edit.summary: An inline edit component allows users to switch between read-only and edits views of description lists, page text elements, or tables—within the context of their current view.

input-group.name: input-group
input-group.title: Input group
input-group.summary: An input group combines multiple related controls or inputs to appear as a single control.

jump-links.name: jump-links
jump-links.title: Jump links
jump-links.summary: When clicked, jump links allow users to navigate to sections within a page without scrolling.

label.name: label
label.title: Label
label.summary: A label is a descriptive annotation that adds context to an element for clarity and convenience.

list.name: list
list.title: List
list.summary: A list component embeds a formatted list—bulleted or numbered—into page content.

login-page.name: login-page
login-page.title: Login page
login-page.summary: A login page allows a user to access an application by entering a username and password, or by authenticating using a social media login.

masthead.name: masthead
masthead.title: Masthead
masthead.summary: A masthead contains and organizes global properties like a logo, navigation, and settings for easy and consistent access across all pages of an application.

menu-toggle.name: menu-toggle
menu-toggle.title: Menu toggle
menu-toggle.summary: A menu toggle is a selectable control that opens and closes a menu.

menu.name: menu
menu.title: Menu
menu.summary: A menu is a list of options or actions that users can choose from.

modal.name: modal
modal.title: Modal
modal.summary: A modal is a window that overlays a page to display important information, without requiring users to navigate to a new page.

navigation.name: navigation
navigation.title: Navigation
navigation.summary: A navigation component organizes and communicates an application's structure and content in a central location, making it easy to find information and accomplish tasks.

notification-badge.name: notification-badge
notification-badge.title: Notification badge
notification-badge.summary: A notification badge is a visual indicator that alerts users about incoming notifications.

notification-drawer.name: notification-drawer
notification-drawer.title: Notification drawer
notification-drawer.summary: A notification drawer contains an application's notifications, which users can view and manage without having to navigate to a new screen.

number-input.name: number-input
number-input.title: Number input
number-input.summary: A number input combines a text input field with buttons to provide users with a quick and effective way to enter and modify a numeric value.

overflow-menu.name: overflow-menu
overflow-menu.title: Overflow menu
overflow-menu.summary: An overflow menu groups a set of actions into a responsive horizontal list to help declutter the UI.

page.name: page
page.title: Page
page.summary: A page component defines the basic layout of a page, with either vertical or horizontal navigation.

pagination.name: pagination
pagination.title: Pagination
pagination.summary: A pagination component allows users to navigate through large content views that have been split across multiple pages.

panel.name: panel
panel.title: Panel
panel.summary: A panel is a customizable container that can contain other components in flexible content layouts.

password-generator.name: password-generator
password-generator.title: Password generator
password-generator.summary: This demo demonstrates how to create an input field that generates unique passwords.

password-strength.name: password-strength
password-strength.title: Password strength
password-strength.summary: This demo demonstrates how to validate and display feedback about password strength.

popover.name: popover
popover.title: Popover
popover.summary: A popover is a small overlay window that provides additional information about an on-screen element.

progress-stepper.name: progress-stepper
progress-stepper.title: Progress stepper
progress-stepper.summary: A progress stepper displays a timeline of tasks in a workflow and tracks a user's progress through the workflow.

progress.name: progress
progress.title: Progress
progress.summary: A progress component is a horizontal bar that indicates the completion status of an ongoing process or task.

radio.name: radio
radio.title: Radio
radio.summary: A radio is a button that's used to present users with mutually exclusive choices.

search-input.name: search-input
search-input.title: Search input
search-input.summary: A search input is a type of input field that can be used to search, find, or filter.

select.name: select
select.title: Select
select.summary: A select component is a menu that enables users to select 1 or more items from a list.

sidebar.name: sidebar
sidebar.title: Sidebar
sidebar.summary: A sidebar is a panel that splits content into a secondary area within a page.

simple-list.name: simple-list
simple-list.title: Simple list
simple-list.summary: A simple list displays selectable items within a page.

skeleton.name: skeleton
skeleton.title: Skeleton
skeleton.summary: A skeleton is a type of loading state that allows you to expose content incrementally.

skip-to-content.name: skip-to-content
skip-to-content.title: Skip to content
skip-to-content.summary: A skip to content component allows users to bypass navigation when using a screen reader or keyboard

slider.name: slider
slider.title: Slider
slider.summary: A slider is an interactive element that allows users to quickly set and adjust a numeric value from a defined range of values.

spinner.name: spinner
spinner.title: Spinner
spinner.summary: A spinner is an animated visual that indicates when a quick action is in progress.

switch.name: switch
switch.title: Switch
switch.summary: A switch is a control that toggles the state of a setting between on and off.

table.name: table
table.title: Table
table.summary: A table displays large data sets in a simple grid with column headers.

tabs.name: tabs
tabs.title: Tabs
tabs.summary: Tabs group similar content within sub-views of a page.

text-area.name: text-area
text-area.title: Text area
text-area.summary: A text area allows users to enter a longer paragraph of text.

text-input-group.name: text-input-group
text-input-group.title: Text input group
text-input-group.summary: A text input group is a more custom, flexible, and composable version of a text input that includes elements like icons and buttons.

text-input.name: text-input
text-input.title: Text input
text-input.summary: A text input components allows users to input short text.

tile.name: tile
tile.title: Tile
tile.summary: A tile is a container that allows users to select a static option.

time-picker.name: time-picker
time-picker.title: Time picker
time-picker.summary: A time picker component allows users to select a time from a list of options.

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.summary: A timestamp is a consistently formatted visual that displays date and time values.

title.name: title
title.title: Title
title.summary: A title component applies top and bottom margins, font-weight, font-size, and line-height to page and section headings.

toggle-group.name: toggle-group
toggle-group.title: Toggle group
toggle-group.summary: A toggle group is a set of controls that can be used to quickly switch between actions or states.

toolbar.name: toolbar
toolbar.title: Toolbar
toolbar.summary: A toolbar is a responsive container that displays controls that allow users to manage and manipulate a data set.

tooltip.name: tooltip
tooltip.title: Tooltip
tooltip.summary: A tooltip is a small, temporary, overlay window that provides additional information about an on-screen element.

tree-view.name: tree-view
tree-view.title: Tree view
tree-view.summary: A tree view is a structure that displays data in a hierarchical view.

truncate.name: truncate
truncate.title: Truncate
truncate.summary: A truncate component can be used to shorten character strings—typically when the string overflows its container.

wizard.name: wizard
wizard.title: Wizard
wizard.summary: A wizard is a guided workflow that helps users complete complex tasks, create objects, or follow a series of steps.
